summary: Email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office staff regarding the reproduction of seven discovery items for Ghislaine Maxwell's defense due to Bates stamping errors. The correspondence includes coordination on drafting a cover letter and sending corrected materials to Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC).

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The discovery materials are being reproduced and sent to her at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) as part of the government's ongoing discovery obligations in her criminal case.

events.title: Discovery Reproduction for Maxwell
events.description: U.S. Attorney's Office staff reproduce seven discovery items (one Excel file and six PDFs) due to Bates stamping errors, correct the Bates numbers, and prepare to send them to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC.

locations: U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Seven discovery items for Ghislaine Maxwell's case required reproduction due to Bates stamping errors (missing digits in Bates numbers).
The corrected materials included one Excel file and six PDFs with updated Bates ranges SDNY_GM_02742184 through SDNY_GM_02742302.
The U.S. Attorney's Office coordinated to send a CD with the reproduced materials to Maxwell at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC) on December 18, 2020.
The correspondence highlights procedural diligence in correcting discovery errors and fulfilling ongoing discovery obligations to the defense.
